text: Paul S. Atkins is a lobbyist, businessperson and politician. He is the CEO of Patomak Global Partners LLC. Atkins was a commissioner of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission from 2002 to 2008 during the George W. Bush administration. In December 2024, President-elect Donald Trump nominated Atkins to serve as Chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission under his second administration. ==Early life== Atkins was born in Lillington, North Carolina. He grew up in Tampa, Florida. He received his A.B. from Wofford College in 1980."Paul S. Atkins" , Patomak website bio. Retrieved 2011-04-22. He received his J.D. from Vanderbilt University School of Law in 1983. ==Career== Atkins was a commissioner of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) from July 9, 2002 until his term's completion in August 2008.SEC Biography: Commissioner Paul S. Atkins, Security Exchange Commission. Retrieved February, 2011. He served with chairmen Harvey Pitt, William H. Donaldson, and Christopher Cox. He was co-chair of the Token Alliance, an advocacy group for the crypto business. On December 4, 2024, President-elect Donald Trump nominated Atkins to serve as Chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission under his second administration. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1950s births Category:Living people Category:Members of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Category:Politicians from North Carolina Category:Businesspeople from North Carolina Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from North Carolina Category:Lawyers from Florida Category:Politicians from Tampa, Florida Category:Businesspeople from Florida Category:Lobbyists
title: Paul S. Atkins
